history.content:
TBSI Undergraduate Research Internships in Science and Engineering at Berkeley (URISE at Berkeley) Supports Undergraduate Engineering and Science Education


Tsinghua-Berkeley Shenzhen Institute (TBSI) is a research and education collaboration of Tsinghua University and UC Berkeley that was established in 2014. It brings together faculty of two top engineering and science academic institutions in the US and China to establish an ecosystem for transformational technology research. Research areas include Environmental Science and New Energy Technology, Information Technology and Data Science, and Precision Medicine and Healthcare. 

The program is currently accepting applications. To be eligible, applicants must be: 1) majoring in engineering, physical sciences, or biological sciences; 2) rising juniors, rising seniors, or non-graduating seniors; 3) currently enrolled in 4-year colleges or universities in the U.S.; 4) US citizens, US permanent residents, or international students.

The application deadline is March 29. The program welcomes referrals of applicants from other summer research internship programs.  

Detailed information: https://tbsi.berkeley.edu/urise-berkeley-2018.  

Questions: Alice Tsai, tbsi@berkeley.edu
